intro: Hieracium polyteuchum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, rough-textured leaves that are often lobed or divided. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium polyteuchum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes and seeds.
